description:
Cohabiting couples

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
In the microcensus, in an (opposite-sex) cohabiting couple
or a same-sex cohabiting couple, two partners live and keep
house together in a household, that is, two opposite-sex or
same-sex partners without a marriage certificate, or two
same-sex partners with a marriage certificate or a notarial
certification. Up to and including the microcensus of 2005,
it was irrelevant whether the cohabiting couple was
registered as a registered same-sex life partnership in
accordance with the Act on Registered Life Partnerships
introduced in 2001. Since 2006, registered life partnerships
have also been covered in the microcensus.
